p: Forty-one microbial isolates were obtained from the healthy leaves of Garcinia cowa ( Figure 6a). The gross morphology and microscopic appearance were all identical. They appeared as a green fluffy growth on the PDA plate with shuttle-shaped spores ( Figure 6b,c). We selected one isolation for further experiments. Genomic DNA was extracted and the fungus was identified using ITS1-4 as the standard primers. The ITS1-4 sequence was 95% identical with the Phyllosticta ampelicida or Guignardia bidwellii isolate G17 ITS sequence (HM049170.1). Therefore, we denoted endophyte as Phyllosticta sp. YGE41.
